_exec_summary.SummaryText:
EXECUTIVE SUMMARY

Central Beef Industries LLC in Center Hill, Florida has developed a Risk Management Program in compliance with the Environmental Protection Agencies final Rule 40 CFR Part 68.  The regulated substance is anhydrous ammonia with a total inventory charge of 19,092 lbs which is over the threshold quantity of 10,000 lbs.  Since the facility is also subject to the Occupational Safety and Health AdministrationA?s PSM Standard 29 CFR 1910.119, Program 3 is required.

ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION POLICY AND EMERGENCY RESPONSE POLICY

The top priority of Central Beef Industries LLC is to provide a healthy and safe work environment for its employees and the surrounding community.  In this effort Central Beef Industries LLC has developed strict policies and procedures to reduce the risk of an accidental hazardous chemical release.  The Process Safety Management (PSM) program acts as a gatekeeper of these policies and procedures.

The requirements of the Occupational Safety and Health AdministrationA?s (OSHA) PSM Standard 29 CFR 1910.119 mirrors that of Risk ManagementA?s Prevention Program 3 and therefore has been integrated.  Of the 14 PSM elements 13 focus on accidental release prevention and one on emergency planning and response.  It is the commitment of management and employees to follow the established procedures and seek new ways for improvement. 

In the event of an emergency Central Beef Industries LLC will evacuate or shelter in place, depending on the type and magnitude of the emergency, its employees and call Sumter County Fire Rescue to respond to the emergency.

STATIONARY SOURCE AND REGULATED SUBSTANCES
Central Beef Industries LLC is a beef manufacturer located in Center Hill, Florida.  The manufacturing process includes refrigerated spaces and production equipment that utilize anhydrous ammonia as the refrigerant.  Anhydrous ammonia is a regulated substance under the Chemical Accidental Prevention Provisions, 40 CFR 68.

GENERAL ACCIDENTAL RE

LEASE PREVENTION PROGRAM
CHEMICAL-SPECIFIC PREVENTION STEPS  

EPAA?s Risk Management Prevention Program 3, 40 CFR Part 68(D) and OSHAA?s Process Safety Management Standard 29 CFR 1910.119 outline the facilities accidental release prevention program.  Included are 13 Chemical Specific Prevention steps implemented by Central Beef Industries LLC and are summarized below.

Employee Participation A? Employees are given shared responsibility with management in the continued evolution of the program.
Process Safety Information A? Chemical, equipment, and system information has been compiled to ensure the safe design and operation.
Process Hazard Analysis A? What-if Checklist completed to identify potential hazards and minimize their impact.
Operating Procedures A? Standard Operating Procedures developed to ensure the safe operation of the process.
Training A? Training program established and operators trained to ensure the safe operation of the process.
Contractors A? Contractor program established to ensure only qualified and trained contractor work on or near the process.
Pre-Startup Safety Review A? Procedures and checklist developed to ensure all safety requirements completed before startup of new or modified process.
Mechanical Integrity A? Program developed to ensure equipment and systems installed per design specifications and maintained per manufacturer recommendations and good engineering practices.
Hot Work Permit A? Permit program established to prevent the potential of fire/explosion resulting from hot work near hazardous chemicals.
Management of Change A? Procedures established to manage process changes to ensure the integrity of the PSM program is maintained.
Incident Investigations A? Procedures established to investigate releases that resulted in or could have resulted in a catastrophic release of a hazardous chemical to prevent reoccurrence.
Compliance Audits A? Procedures established to periodically review program implementation and to correct as necessa

ry.
Trade Secrets A? Policy implemented to provide all necessary information regardless of trade secrets to ensure the employee safety.

ACCIDENT HISTORY - LAST FIVE YEARS

There is no accident history in the past five years.

EMERGENCY RESPONSE PROGRAM

Central Beef Industries LLC is included in the written community emergency response plan. This facility has its own emergency action plan. The emergency action plan includes procedures for informing the public and local response agencies of a chemical release. The emergency action plan also includes information on emergency health care.
Central Beef Industries LLC does not respond to emergencies.  Central Beef Industries LLC coordinates its Emergency Action Plan with Sumter County Fire Rescue.
PLANNED CHANGES TO IMPROVE SAFETY

Central Beef Industries LLC planned changes to improve safety include centralizing its ammonia equipment into an enclosed machinery room.

Central Beef Industries LLC has recently performed a hazard analysis per their Process Safety Management and Risk Management programs.  Areas for improvement during the hazard analysis were identified and corrective actions recommended.  All recommendations are promptly addressed.
